attributes.action: stop production of the 1p & 2p copper coins
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
These coins have been produced since decimalisation in 1971 at which time it was possible to buy individual items costing 1p or 2p

There is practically nothing now which cost either 1p or 2p and production of these coins cannot be cost effective so should therefore cease.

Everything would then need to be priced in multiples of 5p which should mean many things being reduced in price from £xx.99 to £xx.95 rather than a general price increase 'rounding-up' which happened when the 1/2p was phased out in the 1980s.
